expected_issues.description: Prescribed antibiotic (Sulfamethoxazole-trimethoprim) with documented severe allergic reaction history
expected_issues.reasoning: Patient has documented severe allergic reaction (Stevens-Johnson syndrome - SJS) to TMP-SMX in allergy history. SJS is a life-threatening severe cutaneous adverse reaction with 20-30% mortality. Re-exposure to culprit drug (sulfonamide antibiotics) can trigger recurrent SJS with higher severity. This is an absolute contraindication. Alternative antibiotics (nitrofurantoin, ciprofloxacin, fosfomycin) must be used for UTI treatment.
